author: RedDragonWebDesign
body:
## Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Consider allowing aliases that include parameters. For example:

![2020-07-07_224514](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43397938/86881609-8f06a100-c0a3-11ea-8de9-b4b3c1425290.png)

[Bash style aliases allow parameters](https://linuxize.com/post/how-to-create-bash-aliases/). It's a nice little feature.

[This question on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4166370/how-can-i-write-a-powershell-alias-with-arguments-in-the-middle) received 72 upvotes, so I am not the only person to have this idea.

## Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Would probably need to modify the `Set-Alias` and `New-Alias` commands.
